title: ExecuteMsg
description: This structure describes the execute messages of the contract.

coin_registry_address.description: The address of the contract that contains the coins and their accuracy

fee_address.description: Contract address to send governance fees to (the Maker)

generator_address.description: Contract address where Lp tokens can be auto_staked after someone provides liquidity in an incentivized Astroport pool

whitelist_code_id.description: CW1 whitelist contract code id used to store 3rd party rewards for staking Astroport LP tokens

oneOf.description: UpdatePairConfig updates the config for a pair type.

config.description: New [`PairConfig`] settings for a pair type

oneOf.description: CreatePair instantiates a new pair contract.

asset_infos.description: The assets to create the pool for

init_params.description: Optional binary serialised parameters for custom pool types

oneOf.description: Deregister removes a previously created pair.

asset_infos.description: The assets for which we deregister a pool

oneOf.description: ProposeNewOwner creates a proposal to change contract ownership. The validity period for the proposal is set in the `expires_in` variable.

expires_in.description: The date after which this proposal expires

oneOf.description: DropOwnershipProposal removes the existing offer to change contract ownership.

Addr.description:
A human readable address.

In Cosmos, this is typically bech32 encoded. But for multi-chain smart contracts no assumptions should be made other than being UTF-8 encoded and of reasonable length.

This type represents a validated address. It can be created in the following ways 1. Use `Addr::unchecked(input)` 2. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_validate(input)?` 3. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_humanize(canonical_addr)?` 4. Deserialize from JSON. This must only be done from JSON that was validated before such as a contract's state. `Addr` must not be used in messages sent by the user because this would result in unvalidated instances.

This type is immutable. If you really need to mutate it (Really? Are you sure?), create a mutable copy using `let mut mutable = Addr::to_string()` and operate on that `String` instance.

AssetInfo.description: This enum describes available Token types. ## Examples ``` # use cosmwasm_std::Addr; # use astroport::asset::AssetInfo::{NativeToken, Token}; Token { contract_addr: Addr::unchecked("stake...") }; NativeToken { denom: String::from("uluna") }; ```

Binary.description:
Binary is a wrapper around Vec<u8> to add base64 de/serialization with serde. It also adds some helper methods to help encode inline.

This is only needed as serde-json-{core,wasm} has a horrible encoding for Vec<u8>. See also <https://github.com/CosmWasm/cosmwasm/blob/main/docs/MESSAGE_TYPES.md>.

PairConfig.description: This structure stores a pair type's configuration.

code_id.description: ID of contract which is allowed to create pairs of this type

is_disabled.description: Whether a pair type is disabled or not. If it is disabled, new pairs cannot be created, but existing ones can still read the pair configuration Default is false.

is_generator_disabled.description: Setting this to true means that pairs of this type will not be able to get an ASTRO generator Default is false.

maker_fee_bps.description: The amount of fees (in bps) collected by the Maker contract from this pair type

permissioned.description: If pool type is permissioned, only factory owner can create pairs of this type. Default is false.

total_fee_bps.description: The total fees (in bps) charged by a pair of this type

PairType.description: This enum describes available pair types. ## Available pool types ``` # use astroport::factory::PairType::{Custom, Stable, Xyk}; Xyk {}; Stable {}; Custom(String::from("Custom")); ```
